Title: Northern Sudan watches the war from afar
Subhead: War in Sudan: A Trapped Nation (6/6). The northern region of Sudan, spared so far from the fighting between the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces and the regular army, has taken in thousands of displaced people. But as the conflict drags on and draws closer, local militias are organizing.

Iran protests swell nationwide as crackdown intensifies and internet is cut
Subhead: The country saw the largest demonstrations in nearly two weeks, with rights groups reporting dozens of protesters killed.

Title: Somalia denies seizing US-funded food aid as Washington suspends assistance
Subhead: The country's authorities have been accused of destroying a World Food Programmeme warehouse and seizing American-funded food aid.

Title: France enjoys another banner year for tourism, buoyed by campgrounds and international visitors
Subhead: International tourism revenue rose by 9% in France in 2025, according to the United Nations World Tourism Organization.

Title: 'Christopher Columbus embodying Trump and Meloni's supremacist fantasies is no coincidence'
Subhead: 'Debated Figures' (1/5). Once praised by French traditionalist Catholics, the 'discoverer of America' is now celebrated by American and Italian leaders, writes historian Romain Bertrand.

'If Doctors Without Borders were to cease activities in Gaza, the impact would be absolutely enormous'
Subhead: In an interview with Le Monde, Filipe Ribeiro, head of mission for Doctors Without Borders in Jerusalem, responds to the Israeli government's decision to ban it and 36 other non-governmental organizations from operating in the occupied Palestinian territories.

Title: French judges alarmed by rumors of US sanctioning magistrates who sentenced Le Pen
Subhead: Peimane Ghaleh-Marzban, the president of the Paris judicial court, spoke out to condemn what he called 'unacceptable interference.' His remarks followed revelations in the German press about the possibility that the United States might sanction the French judges who sentenced Marine Le Pen.

Title: Venezuela: How the US spent months preparing the military operation to capture Maduro
Subhead: Images verified by Le Monde made it possible to reconstruct the US's vast military deployment at sea, on land and in the air in the months leading up to the abduction of the Venezuelan president.
